sections.name: ODML-Amplifier
sections.definition: The amplifier section defines elements that can be used to describe amplifier properties and settings.

properties.name: SerialNo
properties.definition: The device's serial number.

properties.name: InventoryNo
properties.definition: The inventory number of the device.

properties.name: Owner
properties.definition: Who's the owner of the device.

properties.name: Model
properties.definition: The model name of this hardware item.

properties.name: Manufacturer
properties.definition: The Manufacturer of this hardware item.

properties.name: HighpassCutoff
properties.definition: The cutoff frequency of the amplifier's highpass filter.

properties.name: LowpassCutoff
properties.definition: The cutoff frequency of the amplifier's lowpass filter.

properties.name: Description
value: digital DC amplifier, input 5V DC, 450 mA
properties.definition: A description of this hardware item.

sections.name: ODML-Analysis
sections.definition: Sections of the Analysis type can be used to describe analyses.

properties.name: Author
properties.definition: The name of the person who did the analysis, e.g. 'John Doe' or 'Doe, John'

properties.name: Date
properties.definition: The date of analysis.

properties.name: Description
properties.definition: A general description of the analysis.

properties.name: Method
properties.definition: The name of a method used in this analysis. E.g. "power spectrum".

properties.name: CommandlineCall
properties.definition: The command used to execute the analysis including the command line parameter.

properties.name: Comment
properties.definition: Specific comments on this analysis.

properties.name: ResultFigure
properties.definition:
A figure showing the results. This property is meant to strore the real figure content. 
         This will blow up the the size of the metadatafile and we recommend to rather define the URL of the figure.

sections.name: ODML-Experiment
sections.definition:
Specification of an experiment. The Experiment is
      part of a Project and the recorded data for a specific
      Experiment are found in Datasets. Possible subsections are, for
      example, Dataset and Stimulus.

properties.name: Description
value: Each patient or their legal representatives are acquainted with the course of the experiment and answered questions concerning his/her health. Each patient is given the standard EEG cap made by Electro-Cap International. The international 10-20 system of electrode placement was used. In fact, 7 electrodes from 19 were used as depicted in Figure. The reference electrode was placed at the root of his/her nose and the ground electrode was placed on the ear. The patient with EEG cap is sitting 1 m from the monitor and is told to watch the stimulation protocols which contain figures, sounds or matrix with activities, and to follow the rules for selecting thoughtful activity. EEG signal from all channels are amplified and together with markers of the events from parallel port interface from stimulation computer are delivered to recording PC. After the experiment is finished, the recorded data and collected metadata are uploaded to the EEG/ERP storage.
properties.definition:
A description of the
         experiment.

properties.name: Type
properties.definition: The type of experiment.

properties.name: ProjectName
value: Brain-driven Computer Assistance System for People with Limited Mobility
properties.definition: The name of the project this experiment belongs to.

properties.name: ProjectID
properties.definition:
The ID of the project this experiment belongs
         to.

properties.name: Software name
properties.definition: The software's name.

properties.name: Owner
properties.definition: The owner of the software.

properties.name: Developer
properties.definition: The developer or the developers firm.

properties.name: Version
properties.definition: Version of the software.

properties.name: Decsription
value: "Presentation is a stimulus delivery and experiment control program for neuroscience. It runs on any Windows PC, and delivers auditory, visual and multimodal stimuli with sub-millisecond temporal precision. Presentation is powerful enough to handle almost any behavioral, psychological or physiological experiment using fMRI, ERP, MEG, psychophysics, eye movements, single neuron recording, reaction time measures, other performance measures, and more." [https://www.neurobs.com/]
properties.definition: The descrisption of the software.

sections.name: ODML-Subject
sections.definition:
The investigated experimental subject (animal or person).
      May contain the Cell and Preparation sections as subsections.

properties.name: Species
properties.definition:
The scientific name of the species e.g. Apis
         mellifera, Homo sapiens.

properties.name: TrivialName
properties.definition:
The trivial name of the species like
         Honeybee, Human.

properties.name: Gender
properties.definition: Male or female?

properties.name: Birthday
properties.definition:
The birthday. Age can be inferred from the
         date of recording.

properties.name: Age
properties.definition:
The age of the subject since birth. E.g. P19,
         or 5 days.

properties.name: HealthStatus
properties.definition:
Information about the health status of this
         subject.
